properties.Scope: Guided Dalkia through a successful CPS Energy sales cycle by creating a dynamic pitch deck for city and utility leaders, designing a comprehensive financial model, assessing infrastructure, and co-authoring the RFP response.

Conducted a comprehensive socio-demographic analysis to inform lighting infrastructure upgrades, including solar options. Redesigned the system to add 6,000 prioritized fixture locations. The city leveraged these insights to issue an RFP.

Developed a unified RFP for traffic and streetlighting to boost savings and operational synergy. Created custom dashboards for leadership and technical teams, automated KPI tracking, and built a cohesive project management framework for actionable reporting. Engineered seven alternative economic models spanning 126,000 streetlights and 759 intersections (valued from $50M to $120M), then prepared both the RFP and evaluation toolkit for streamlined offer reviews.

Developed a custom Lighting Master Plan for Mexico’s “spider” roadway network, retrofitted 50,000 streetlights, and illuminated 14 monuments and 31 iconic buildings—resulting in 25% energy savings and a 9,000-ton CO2 reduction.

Achieved a 240 GWh reduction in Paris’s energy footprint while preserving its historic charm. Evaluated seven fixture vendors and designed six alternative solutions for 177,000 streetlights—contributing to the $770M, 10-year upgrade and operation contract awarded to CIELIS.

Developed a resiliency-focused master plan for lighting, power generation, and emergency communications infrastructure. Evaluated solutions for hardening lighting systems—including solar options—and prioritizing security and disaster recovery.

Conducted a comprehensive socio-demographic analysis using open and closed data sources, then evaluated solutions for expanding lighting infrastructure—including solar systems—to meet the city’s evolving needs.
Ghostwrote a feasibility analysis addressing solutions such as trimming, centralized traffic lights, park lighting, and duplicate fixtures, complete with strategic financial planning.
Ghostwrote a feasibility analysis addressing solutions such as trimming, centralized traffic lights, park lighting, and duplicate fixtures, complete with strategic financial planning.
Conducted an in-depth market study and assessed the viability of a product for the US market
Prepared a robust financial model, developed compelling presentations and commercial materials, and structured P3 trusts and SPVs—laying the groundwork for an effective RFP response.
Carried out an energy efficiency study.
Carried out an energy efficiency study.
Identified high-fatality hotspots in Nueces County to advance Vision Zero objectives and enhance traffic safety.
Analyzed Espanola's street lighting system, Formulated a three-pronged strategy to relocate unnecessary assets, convert legacy assets to LED, and use solar lights to fill gaps
Conducted a photometric study for the city of Chihuahua.
Built a comprehensive ERP for a system-wide LED retrofit, deployment of a smart mesh network, and O&M planning.
Drafted and modeled a comprehensive LED and smart lighting conversion plan with a strong emphasis on community engagement.
Prepared an ERP based on in-depth research into Saco's street lighting system and broader socio-economic context.
Wrote a full-scope Smart & Lighting Master Plan analyzing 15 design scenarios.
Designed artistic lighting for a proposed bridge in San Luis Obispo County.
